name: Nicaragua
description: Nicaragua, often called the 'Land of Lakes,' is a nation of stunning contrasts. From the volcanic peaks of the Cordillera Mototombo-Sibasco to the vast, sun-drenched beaches of the Caribbean and Pacific coasts, Nicaragua offers a diverse landscape and rich cultural heritage. It’s a country of vibrant traditions, friendly people, and a burgeoning ecotourism industry.

quickFacts.label: Capital
quickFacts.description: The bustling capital city, situated in a volcanic caldera.
quickFacts.detail: Managua is a major economic and political center, offering a mix of colonial architecture and modern development.

quickFacts.label: Population
quickFacts.detail: The median age is around 22 years, reflecting a dynamic and growing nation.

quickFacts.label: Area
quickFacts.detail: Nicaragua is bordered by Honduras to the north, Costa Rica to the south, and the Caribbean Sea and Pacific Ocean to the east and west.

quickFacts.label: Official Language
quickFacts.detail: Indigenous languages are also spoken in various regions.

quickFacts.label: Currency
quickFacts.detail: Exchange rates fluctuate; check current rates before traveling.

quickFacts.label: GDP
quickFacts.description: A developing economy with growth potential.
quickFacts.detail: Tourism, agriculture, and services are key sectors.

climateData.title: Climate Overview
climateData.description: Nicaragua experiences a tropical climate with variations depending on altitude and proximity to the coast. The Pacific coast is generally hot and dry, while the Caribbean coast is warm and humid with significant rainfall.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Dry Season (November - April)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: The coolest and driest period, ideal for exploring the highlands and beaches.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Wet Season (May - October)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Characterized by heavy rainfall, particularly on the Caribbean coast.  The Pacific coast remains relatively dry.

seasonalCharacteristics.name: Hurricane Season (June - November)
seasonalCharacteristics.description: Nicaragua is susceptible to hurricanes during this period.  Monitor weather forecasts closely.

naturalWonders.name: Volcán Concepción
naturalWonders.description: Volcán Concepción is an active, towering stratovolcano located in the Sierra de los Chirros mountain range. It’s one of the most visually striking and active volcanoes in Central America, offering a challenging but rewarding climb for experienced hikers.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: Concepción last erupted in 1999, and continues to exhibit signs of activity. The surrounding crater lake, Lago de Concepcion, is a stunning turquoise color.  The hike to the summit requires significant preparation and acclimatization.

naturalWonders.name: Las Peñas Archipelago
naturalWonders.description: A stunning chain of islands off the Caribbean coast, renowned for its diverse birdlife and pristine beaches.  Las Peñas is a vital nesting ground for numerous seabird species.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The archipelago consists of several small islands, each with unique ecosystems.  The islands are largely uninhabited, offering a truly remote and unspoiled experience.  The waters surrounding Las Peñas are teeming with marine life.

naturalWonders.name: Cerro Zelote
naturalWonders.description: Cerro Zelote is a dramatic mountain range in northern Nicaragua, known for its rugged terrain, cloud forests, and abundant wildlife. It’s a popular destination for experienced hikers and nature enthusiasts.
naturalWonders.detailedDescription: The range is characterized by steep slopes, dense vegetation, and numerous waterfalls. Cerro Zelote is home to a variety of endemic plant and animal species, including jaguars, monkeys, and colorful birds. The area is also rich in cultural heritage, with numerous indigenous communities.

biodiversityCategory.name: Tropical Rainforests
biodiversityCategory.description: Nicaragua is home to extensive tropical rainforests, harboring an incredible diversity of plant and animal life. These forests play a crucial role in regulating the country’s climate and providing essential ecosystem services.

statistics.details: Nicaragua boasts one of the highest tree species diversity in the world.
Many plant and animal species are found only in Nicaragua.

notableSpecies.name: Jaguar
notableSpecies.significance: A top predator in the rainforest ecosystem.

notableSpecies.name: Three-toed Sloth
notableSpecies.significance: A slow-moving herbivore adapted to life in the canopy.

notableSpecies.name: Resplendent Quetzal
notableSpecies.significance: A brilliantly colored bird revered by ancient cultures.

ecosystemData.title: Nicaraguan Ecosystems
ecosystemData.overview: Nicaragua’s ecosystems are incredibly diverse, ranging from tropical rainforests and cloud forests to coastal wetlands and volcanic landscapes. These ecosystems provide vital resources and support a rich array of biodiversity.

conservationStatus.protectedAreas: Approximately 25% of the country's land area is protected in national parks and reserves.

biodiversityCategories.name: Tropical Rainforests
biodiversityCategories.description: The heart of Nicaragua’s biodiversity, characterized by high rainfall and dense vegetation.

statistics.details: High rainfall supports lush vegetation growth.

biodiversityCategories.name: Coastal Wetlands
biodiversityCategories.description: Important habitats for migratory birds and marine life, providing crucial ecosystem services.

statistics.details: Mangroves protect coastlines from erosion and provide nursery grounds for fish.

activities.title: Outdoor Activities in Nicaragua
activities.description: Nicaragua offers a wide range of outdoor activities for all skill levels, from hiking and birdwatching to water sports and adventure tourism.

activityCategories.name: Hiking
activityCategories.description: Explore Nicaragua’s stunning mountain ranges and cloud forests.

activities.name: Cerro Zelote Trek
activities.description: A challenging trek through a remote mountain range, offering breathtaking views and diverse wildlife encounters.
activities.requirements: Good physical fitness, hiking boots, rain gear

activities.name: Granada Volcano Hike
activities.description: Hike to the summit of Granada Volcano for panoramic views of Lake Nicaragua.

activityCategories.name: Water Sports
activityCategories.description: Enjoy a variety of water activities on Nicaragua’s beautiful coasts and lakes.

activities.name: Surfing at San Juan del Sur
activities.description: Catch some waves at San Juan del Sur, a popular surfing destination.

activities.name: Kayaking on Lake Nicaragua
activities.description: Explore the stunning scenery of Lake Nicaragua by kayak.
